verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying unto them,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying to them,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron and said to them,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, These are the beasts which ye shall eat among all the beasts that are on the earth.
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘These are the living things which you may eat among all the animals that are on the earth.
verses.ct: "Tell the people of Israel: Of all the animals on earth, these are the ones you may eat.

verses.kjv: Whatsoever parteth the hoof, and is clovenfooted, and cheweth the cud, among the beasts, that shall ye eat.
verses.web: Whatever parts the hoof, and is cloven-footed, and chews the cud among the animals, that you may eat.
verses.ct: You may eat any animal that has a completely split hoof and also chews its cud.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless these shall ye not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the hoof: as the camel, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he is unclean unto you.
verses.web: “ ‘Nevertheless these you shall not eat of those that chew the cud, or of those who part the hoof: the camel, because it chews the cud but doesn’t have a parted hoof, is unclean to you.
verses.ct: However, some animals only chew the cud or only have a split hoof — you must not eat those. The camel, for example, chews its cud but doesn't have a split hoof, so it is unclean for you.

verses.kjv: And the coney, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he is unclean unto you.
verses.web: The hyrax, because it chews the cud but doesn’t have a parted hoof, is unclean to you.
verses.ct: The coney chews its cud but doesn't have a split hoof, so it is unclean for you.

verses.kjv: And the hare, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he is unclean unto you.
verses.web: The hare, because it chews the cud but doesn’t have a parted hoof, is unclean to you.
verses.ct: The hare chews its cud but doesn't have a split hoof, so it is unclean for you.

verses.kjv: And the swine, though he divide the hoof, and be clovenfooted, yet he cheweth not the cud; he is unclean to you.
verses.web: The pig, because it has a split hoof, and is cloven-footed, but doesn’t chew the cud, is unclean to you.
verses.ct: The pig has a completely split hoof, but it doesn't chew its cud, so it is unclean for you.

verses.kjv: Of their flesh shall ye not eat, and their carcase shall ye not touch; they are unclean to you.
verses.web: You shall not eat their meat. You shall not touch their carcasses. They are unclean to you.
verses.ct: You must not eat the meat of these animals or even touch their dead bodies. They are unclean for you.

verses.kjv: These shall ye eat of all that are in the waters: whatsoever hath fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, them shall ye eat.
verses.web: “ ‘These you may eat of all that are in the waters: whatever has fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, that you may eat.
verses.ct: Of everything that lives in the water — whether in the seas or the rivers — you may eat anything that has both fins and scales.

verses.kjv: And all that have not fins and scales in the seas, and in the rivers, of all that move in the waters, and of any living thing which is in the waters, they shall be an abomination unto you:
verses.web: All that don’t have fins and scales in the seas and rivers, all that move in the waters, and all the living creatures that are in the waters, they are an abomination to you,
verses.ct: But any creature in the seas or rivers that doesn't have fins and scales — whether it swims or simply lives in the water — you must treat as detestable.

verses.kjv: They shall be even an abomination unto you; ye shall not eat of their flesh, but ye shall have their carcases in abomination.
verses.web: and you shall detest them. You shall not eat of their meat, and you shall detest their carcasses.
verses.ct: They must be completely detestable to you. Don't eat their meat, and treat their dead bodies as something disgusting.

verses.kjv: Whatsoever hath no fins nor scales in the waters, that shall be an abomination unto you.
verses.web: Whatever has no fins nor scales in the waters is an abomination to you.
verses.ct: Anything in the water that lacks fins and scales is detestable to you.

verses.kjv: And these are they which ye shall have in abomination among the fowls; they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, and the ossifrage, and the ospray,
verses.web: “ ‘You shall detest these among the birds; they shall not be eaten because they are an abomination: the eagle, the vulture, the black vulture,
verses.ct: Among the birds, these are the ones you must treat as detestable and never eat: the eagle, the ossifrage, and the ospray,

verses.kjv: And the vulture, and the kite after his kind;
verses.web: the red kite, any kind of black kite,
verses.ct: the vulture, and every kind of kite,

verses.kjv: Every raven after his kind;
verses.web: any kind of raven,
verses.ct: every kind of raven,

verses.kjv: And the owl, and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind,
verses.web: the horned owl, the screech owl, the gull, any kind of hawk,
verses.ct: the owl, the night hawk, the cuckow, and every kind of hawk,

verses.kjv: And the little owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl,
verses.web: the little owl, the cormorant, the great owl,
verses.ct: the little owl, the cormorant, the great owl,

verses.kjv: And the swan, and the pelican, and the gier eagle,
verses.web: the white owl, the desert owl, the osprey,
verses.ct: the swan, the pelican, the gier eagle,

verses.kjv: And the stork, the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.
verses.web: the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe, and the bat.
verses.ct: the stork, every kind of heron, the lapwing, and the bat.

verses.kjv: All fowls that creep, going upon all four, shall be an abomination unto you.
verses.web: “ ‘All flying insects that walk on all fours are an abomination to you.
verses.ct: All flying insects that walk on 4 legs are detestable to you.

verses.kjv: Yet these may ye eat of every flying creeping thing that goeth upon all four, which have legs above their feet, to leap withal upon the earth;
verses.web: Yet you may eat these: of all winged creeping things that go on all fours, which have long, jointed legs for hopping on the earth.
verses.ct: However, you may eat flying insects that walk on 4 legs if they have jointed hind legs designed for hopping on the ground.

verses.kjv: Even these of them ye may eat; the locust after his kind, and the bald locust after his kind, and the beetle after his kind, and the grasshopper after his kind.
verses.web: Even of these you may eat: any kind of locust, any kind of katydid, any kind of cricket, and any kind of grasshopper.
verses.ct: Specifically, you may eat any kind of locust, any kind of bald locust, any kind of beetle, and any kind of grasshopper.

verses.kjv: But all other flying creeping things, which have four feet, shall be an abomination unto you.
verses.web: But all winged creeping things which have four feet are an abomination to you.
verses.ct: But every other flying insect that walks on 4 legs is detestable to you.

verses.kjv: And for these ye shall be unclean: whosoever toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean until the even.
verses.web: “ ‘By these you will become unclean: whoever touches their carcass shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.ct: These creatures will make you unclean. Anyone who touches their dead body will be unclean until evening.

verses.kjv: And whosoever beareth ought of the carcase of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.
verses.web: Whoever carries any part of their carcass shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening.
verses.ct: Anyone who carries any part of their dead body must wash their clothes and will be unclean until evening.

verses.kjv: The carcases of every beast which divideth the hoof, and is not clovenfooted, nor cheweth the cud, are unclean unto you: every one that toucheth them shall be unclean.
verses.web: “ ‘Every animal which has a split hoof that isn’t completely divided, or doesn’t chew the cud, is unclean to you. Everyone who touches them shall be unclean.
verses.ct: Every animal that has a split hoof but not a completely divided one, or that doesn't chew its cud, is unclean for you. Anyone who touches one of these animals becomes unclean.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever goeth upon his paws, among all manner of beasts that go on all four, those are unclean unto you: whoso toucheth their carcase shall be unclean until the even.
verses.web: Whatever goes on its paws, among all animals that go on all fours, they are unclean to you. Whoever touches their carcass shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.ct: Among all the 4-legged animals, any that walk on paws are unclean for you. Anyone who touches their dead body will be unclean until evening.

verses.kjv: And he that beareth the carcase of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: they are unclean unto you.
verses.web: He who carries their carcass shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening. They are unclean to you.
verses.ct: Anyone who carries their dead body must wash their clothes and will be unclean until evening. These animals are unclean for you.

verses.kjv: These also shall be unclean unto you among the creeping things that creep upon the earth; the weasel, and the mouse, and the tortoise after his kind,
verses.web: “ ‘These are they which are unclean to you among the creeping things that creep on the earth: the weasel, the rat, any kind of great lizard,
verses.ct: Among the creatures that crawl along the ground, these are unclean for you: the weasel, the mouse, and every kind of tortoise,

verses.kjv: And the ferret, and the chameleon, and the lizard, and the snail, and the mole.
verses.web: the gecko, and the monitor lizard, the wall lizard, the skink, and the chameleon.
verses.ct: the ferret, the chameleon, the lizard, the snail, and the mole.

verses.kjv: These are unclean to you among all that creep: whosoever doth touch them, when they be dead, shall be unclean until the even.
verses.web: These are they which are unclean to you among all that creep. Whoever touches them when they are dead shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.ct: These are the creatures that make you unclean. Anyone who touches one of them after it has died will be unclean until evening.

verses.kjv: And upon whatsoever any of them, when they are dead, doth fall, it shall be unclean; whether it be any vessel of wood, or raiment, or skin, or sack, whatsoever vessel it be, wherein any work is done, it must be put into water, and it shall be unclean until the even; so it shall be cleansed.
verses.web: Anything they fall on when they are dead shall be unclean; whether it is any vessel of wood, or clothing, or skin, or sack, whatever vessel it is, with which any work is done, it must be put into water, and it shall be unclean until the evening. Then it will be clean.
verses.ct: If one of these creatures dies and falls on something, that object becomes unclean — whether it's made of wood, cloth, leather, or sackcloth, or any tool used for work. It must be soaked in water and will remain unclean until evening. After that, it will be clean again.

verses.kjv: And every earthen vessel, whereinto any of them falleth, whatsoever is in it shall be unclean; and ye shall break it.
verses.web: Every earthen vessel into which any of them falls and all that is in it shall be unclean. You shall break it.
verses.ct: If one of them falls into a clay pot, everything inside the pot becomes unclean, and you must smash the pot.

verses.kjv: Of all meat which may be eaten, that on which such water cometh shall be unclean: and all drink that may be drunk in every such vessel shall be unclean.
verses.web: All food which may be eaten which is soaked in water shall be unclean. All drink that may be drunk in every such vessel shall be unclean.
verses.ct: Any food that has been in contact with water from such a pot becomes unclean, and any drink in such a container becomes unclean.

verses.kjv: And every thing whereupon any part of their carcase falleth shall be unclean; whether it be oven, or ranges for pots, they shall be broken down: for they are unclean, and shall be unclean unto you.
verses.web: Everything whereupon part of their carcass falls shall be unclean; whether oven, or range for pots, it shall be broken in pieces. They are unclean, and shall be unclean to you.
verses.ct: Anything that part of their dead body falls on becomes unclean. If it's an oven or a cooking stove, it must be smashed to pieces. It is unclean and must remain unclean for you.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless a fountain or pit, wherein there is plenty of water, shall be clean: but that which toucheth their carcase shall be unclean.
verses.web: Nevertheless a spring or a cistern in which water is gathered shall be clean, but that which touches their carcass shall be unclean.
verses.ct: A spring or a cistern that collects water will still be clean, but anyone who touches the dead body in it becomes unclean.

verses.kjv: And if any part of their carcase fall upon any sowing seed which is to be sown, it shall be clean.
verses.web: If part of their carcass falls on any sowing seed which is to be sown, it is clean.
verses.ct: If part of a dead body falls on dry planting seed that is ready to be sown, the seed remains clean.

verses.kjv: But if any water be put upon the seed, and any part of their carcase fall thereon, it shall be unclean unto you.
verses.web: But if water is put on the seed, and part of their carcass falls on it, it is unclean to you.
verses.ct: But if water has been put on the seed and then part of a dead body falls on it, that seed is unclean for you.

verses.kjv: And if any beast, of which ye may eat, die; he that toucheth the carcase thereof shall be unclean until the even.
verses.web: “ ‘If any animal of which you may eat dies, he who touches its carcass shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.ct: If an animal you're normally allowed to eat dies on its own, anyone who touches its dead body will be unclean until evening.

verses.kjv: And he that eateth of the carcase of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: he also that beareth the carcase of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.
verses.web: He who eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening. He also who carries its carcass shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening.
verses.ct: Anyone who eats meat from its dead body must wash their clothes and will be unclean until evening. Anyone who carries its dead body must also wash their clothes and will be unclean until evening.

verses.kjv: And every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth shall be an abomination; it shall not be eaten.
verses.web: “ ‘Every creeping thing that creeps on the earth is an abomination. It shall not be eaten.
verses.ct: Every creature that crawls along the ground is detestable and must not be eaten.

verses.kjv: Whatsoever goeth upon the belly, and whatsoever goeth upon all four, or whatsoever hath more feet among all creeping things that creep upon the earth, them ye shall not eat; for they are an abomination.
verses.web: Whatever goes on its belly, and whatever goes on all fours, or whatever has many feet, even all creeping things that creep on the earth, them you shall not eat; for they are an abomination.
verses.ct: Whether it slithers on its belly, walks on 4 legs, or has many legs — no creature that crawls on the ground may be eaten. They are all detestable.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not make yourselves abominable with any creeping thing that creepeth, neither shall ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should be defiled thereby.
verses.web: You shall not make yourselves abominable with any creeping thing that creeps. You shall not make yourselves unclean with them, that you should be defiled by them.
verses.ct: Don't make yourselves disgusting by eating any crawling creature. Don't defile yourselves with them or let them make you unclean.

verses.kjv: For I am the LORD your God: ye shall therefore sanctify yourselves, and ye shall be holy; for I am holy: neither shall ye defile yourselves with any manner of creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
verses.web: For I am LORD your God. Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be holy; for I am holy. You shall not defile yourselves with any kind of creeping thing that moves on the earth.
verses.ct: I am the LORD your God. Set yourselves apart and be holy, because I am holy. Do not defile yourselves with any creature that crawls on the ground.

verses.kjv: For I am the LORD that bringeth you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: ye shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.
verses.web: For I am LORD who brought you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God. You shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.
verses.ct: I am the LORD who brought you out of Egypt to be your God. You must be holy, because I am holy.

verses.kjv: This is the law of the beasts, and of the fowl, and of every living creature that moveth in the waters, and of every creature that creepeth upon the earth:
verses.web: “ ‘This is the law of the animal, and of the bird, and of every living creature that moves in the waters, and of every creature that creeps on the earth,
verses.ct: These are the instructions regarding animals, birds, every living creature that moves through the water, and every creature that crawls on the ground.

verses.kjv: To make a difference between the unclean and the clean, and between the beast that may be eaten and the beast that may not be eaten.
verses.web: to make a distinction between the unclean and the clean, and between the living thing that may be eaten and the living thing that may not be eaten.’ ”
verses.ct: Their purpose is to help you distinguish between what is unclean and what is clean — between creatures you may eat and creatures you may not."
